thread.title: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend First Look: Rebecca Duets with Her Childhood Self
thread.title_full: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend First Look: Rebecca Duets with Her Childhood Self

author: TV Guide
title: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend First Look: Rebecca Duets with Her Childhood Self
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:54 AM Updated at 1:00 PM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:54 AM Updated at 1:00 PM On Monday's Crazy Ex-Girlfriend , Rebecca ( Rachel Bloom ) decides to throw a party in an attempt to get closer to Josh ( Vincent Rodriguez III ). But the whole ordeal only serves to resurface a lot of Rebecca's deep-rooted childhood anxieties. It turns out that the last time Rebecca hosted a party, barely anyone showed up, her father walked out on her family and she didn't even get to watch the boy band pay-per-view she had thrown the party to see. Crazy Ex-Girlfriend star explains the show's insanity But thanks to some convincing from Paula ( Donna Lynne Champlin ), Rebecca decides to go for it anyways. And as a way to reassure herself that this isn't a total mistake, Rebecca celebrates her decision by singing a duet with her younger self ( Ava Acres ) to the peppy, but fairly depressing, tune "We Have Friends." Check out a first look at the two Rebeccas singing together below: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend airs Mondays at 8/7c on The CW. (Full Disclosure: TVGuide.com is owned by CBS, one of The CW's parent companies.) By TV Guide
